block.p: Jessica Mabel Stretton and Charles Rudd Mackenzie were married yesterday at the First Unitarian Church in Providence, R.I. The Rev. Carson G. Taylor, a minister of the Universal Life Church and an uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Mackenzie, 28, was until last month the grants coordinator at Partnerships for Parks, a joint program of the City Parks Foundation and the New York City Parks Department. She graduated from Grinnell College and was the founder of the Little Seed Garden Community Supported Agriculture Group, an organization of Manhattan shareholders in the harvest of a farm in Columbia County, N.Y.

Jessica Mabel Stretton and Charles Rudd Mackenzie were married yesterday at the First Unitarian Church in Providence, R.I. The Rev. Carson G. Taylor, a minister of the Universal Life Church and an uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Mackenzie, 28, was until last month the grants coordinator at Partnerships for Parks, a joint program of the City Parks Foundation and the New York City Parks Department. She graduated from Grinnell College and was the founder of the Little Seed Garden Community Supported Agriculture Group, an organization of Manhattan shareholders in the harvest of a farm in Columbia County, N.Y.

She is the daughter of Sandra C. Stretton and Thomas E. Stretton Jr., both of Long Valley, N.J. Her father is a residential real estate agent in Chester, N.J., for Weichert Realtors. Her mother is a dog groomer in Long Valley.
The bride is a descendant of Thomas Sully, the 19th-century American painter.

Mr. Mackenzie, 35, is a lawyer in Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y. He is also a director of Volunteers for Peace, a cultural exchange and community service organization in Belmont, Vt. He graduated from Bowdoin College and received a law degree cum laude from Vermont Law School. He is a son of Susan Taylor Menges of Little Compton, R.I., and Alan E. Mackenzie of Westport, Conn. His mother is a technical writer. His father is a business consultant in Westport to cable television.
The bridegroom is a descendant of William Brewster, a leader of the Plymouth Colony.
